ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.points

Class GPSTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.points.GPSTracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.location.LocationListener

    public class GPSTracker
extends android.app.Service
implements android.location.LocationListener
    GPSTracker is a class that provides update on the user location for the UserPoint class. It is observed by userPoint. It incapsulates the state information needed for retrieving the user location. It extends Service and implements LocationListener, that allow for the UserPoint to get notified and update when a change in location is detected
    • MIN_DISTANCE_CHANGE_FOR_UPDATES is the minimum delta in meters that can be detected
    • MIN_TIME_BW_UPDATES is the minimum time in milliseconds to pass to request a new location

      • onLocationChanged

        public void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
        Method from interface LocationListener. Called when the location has changed and locations are being delivered in batches. Once called it will update the UserPoint that is observing this object.
        Specified by:
        onLocationChanged in interface android.location.LocationListener
        Parameters:

                            int status,

        Method from interface LocationListener. This method was deprecated in API level 29. This callback will never be invoked on Android Q and above. Once called it will update the UserPoint that is observing this object.
